subject: Re: [junit] When "extends TestCase" added, annotations don't work
msgSnippet: If you extend TestCase, you get a JUnit 3 test and so the test runner will look for methods starting with test and ignore annotations. If you want to use
messageBody:
If you extend TestCase, you get a JUnit 3 test and so the test runner
will look for methods starting with "test" and ignore annotations.

If you want to use asserts in JUnit 4 tests, statically import them
from org.junit.Assert, or extend org.junit.Assert.

--Nat
